events.name: Sodium-ion Battery Development
events.wd_description: Sodium-ion batteries (NIBs) emerged as a promising alternative to lithium-ion batteries (LIBs) due to their cost-effectiveness, natural abundance, and safer materials. These batteries use sodium ions as charge carriers and have gained significant academic and commercial interest in the 2010s and early 2020s.
events.description: Sodium-ion batteries (NIBs) emerged as a promising alternative to lithium-ion batteries (LIBs) due to their cost-effectiveness, natural abundance, and safer materials. These batteries use sodium ions as charge carriers and have gained significant academic and commercial interest in the 2010s and early 2020s.

events.name: Construction Principles
events.wd_description: Sodium-ion batteries work on principles similar to lithium-ion batteries but replace lithium with sodium as the intercalating ion. The chemical properties of sodium are similar to lithium due to their position in the same group in the periodic table, but SIBs can differ significantly in some cases, such as with aqueous batteries.
events.description: Sodium-ion batteries work on principles similar to lithium-ion batteries but replace lithium with sodium as the intercalating ion. The chemical properties of sodium are similar to lithium due to their position in the same group in the periodic table, but SIBs can differ significantly in some cases, such as with aqueous batteries.

events.name: ium Ion Role
events.wd_description: Sodium ions (Na+) are used as the charge carriers in sodium-ion batteries.
events.description: Sodium ions (Na+) are used as the charge carriers in sodium-ion batteries.

events.name: mical Properties
events.wd_description: Sodium belongs to the same group in the periodic table as lithium, giving it similar chemical properties.
events.description: Sodium belongs to the same group in the periodic table as lithium, giving it similar chemical properties.

events.name: ferences from LIBs
events.wd_description: SIBs can be quite different from LIBs in cases such as aqueous batteries, despite having a similar working principle and cell construction in other aspects.
events.description: SIBs can be quite different from LIBs in cases such as aqueous batteries, despite having a similar working principle and cell construction in other aspects.

events.name: Material Advantages
events.wd_description: Sodium-ion batteries have advantages over lithium-ion batteries due to the natural abundance of sodium and the use of more abundant iron-based materials, avoiding the need for cobalt, copper, and nickel.
events.description: Sodium-ion batteries have advantages over lithium-ion batteries due to the natural abundance of sodium and the use of more abundant iron-based materials, avoiding the need for cobalt, copper, and nickel.

events.name: ndance of Sodium
events.wd_description: Sodium is naturally abundant, particularly in saltwater, making it a cost-effective alternative to lithium.
events.description: Sodium is naturally abundant, particularly in saltwater, making it a cost-effective alternative to lithium.

events.name: n-Based Materials
events.wd_description: Many types of sodium-ion batteries use iron-based materials like NaFeO2, which are more abundant and do not require cobalt, copper, or nickel.
events.description: Many types of sodium-ion batteries use iron-based materials like NaFeO2, which are more abundant and do not require cobalt, copper, or nickel.

events.name: ic Radius Differences
events.wd_description: The ionic radius of Na+ is larger than Fe2+ and Fe3+, preventing their mixing in the cathode material during battery cycling, unlike the similar ionic radii of Li+ and Fe.
events.description: The ionic radius of Na+ is larger than Fe2+ and Fe3+, preventing their mixing in the cathode material during battery cycling, unlike the similar ionic radii of Li+ and Fe.

events.name: wer Intercalation Kinetics
events.wd_description: A downside of the larger ionic radius of Na+ is slower intercalation kinetics of sodium-ion electrode materials, affecting battery performance.
events.description: A downside of the larger ionic radius of Na+ is slower intercalation kinetics of sodium-ion electrode materials, affecting battery performance.

events.name: Comparison with Other Batteries
events.wd_description: Sodium-ion batteries are compared to lithium-ion and rechargeable lead-acid batteries, showing advantages such as lower cost and better safety characteristics but a lower energy density.
events.description: Sodium-ion batteries are compared to lithium-ion and rechargeable lead-acid batteries, showing advantages such as lower cost and better safety characteristics but a lower energy density.

events.name: t Comparison
events.wd_description: Sodium-ion batteries generally have a lower cost compared to lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: Sodium-ion batteries generally have a lower cost compared to lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: ety Characteristics
events.wd_description: Sodium-ion batteries exhibit better safety characteristics compared to lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: Sodium-ion batteries exhibit better safety characteristics compared to lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: er Delivery Characteristics
events.wd_description: Sodium-ion batteries have similar power delivery characteristics to lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: Sodium-ion batteries have similar power delivery characteristics to lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: rgy Density Comparison
events.wd_description: Sodium-ion batteries have a lower energy density compared to lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: Sodium-ion batteries have a lower energy density compared to lithium-ion batteries.
